articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The IDF says it wrongly believed the trio were a "threat" and opened fire on them during combat.
articles.title: Israel-Gaza latest news: Protests in Tel Aviv after Israel mistakenly kills hostages in Gaza

articles.description: Layla Moran says her family are trapped in a church in Gaza City without water or food.
articles.title: Layla Moran's family among hundreds trapped in Gaza church

articles.description: Vatican court sentences Italian cardinal Angelo Becciu, a former adviser to Pope Francis, to five-and-a-half years in jail for financial crimes
articles.title: Vatican court jails former Pope adviser for financial crimes

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Royal Navy has not shot down an aerial target in anger since 1991, the Ministry of Defence says.
articles.title: HMS Diamond: British warship shoots down suspected attack drone in Red Sea

articles.description: Luton's Premier League match at Bournemouth is abandoned after their captain Tom Lockyer collapses on the pitch.
articles.title: Game abandoned after Lockyer collapses on pitch

articles.description: Actor and comedian Steve Coogan says the press needs "proper, independent regulation".
articles.title: Steve Coogan: Prince Harry's hacking case is 'start of something'

articles.description: Donald Trump's former personal lawyer was sued by an ex-poll worker he accused of vote tampering.
articles.title: Rudy Giuliani must pay millions over false election claims

articles.description: Actor Matthew Perry's death was accident caused by "acute effects of ketamine", LA medical examiner says.
articles.title: Perry death an accident caused by ketamine - coroner

articles.description: MSC, the world's largest shipping group, becomes the fourth company to divert ships following attacks.
articles.title: More shipping firms stop Red Sea routes over Houthi attacks

articles.description: Jacob Zuma says it would be a betrayal to campaign for Cyril Ramaphosa and has launched a new party.
